channel.title: @mitb
channel.description:
Just wondering, why haven't you adding commenting on the server statuses? It would be cool, and it's relatively simple to add..
I'm sure you know how to add it yourself, which is why I'm asking.

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Interesting approach. The only potential problem I see when comparing RS servers vs Minecraft servers is I’m afraid that, here, server owners themselves would be constantly posting on other posts putting them down to try to get people on their server instead. Is there that sort of contention with minecraft servers?

Thing is, minecraft private servers are completely different from rsps. Your main demographic is server owners, not server players. At the very least, not counting ads, this site gets all of its money from server owners, not server players. So you should be aiming to please the owners. I for one wouldn’t want to have to police my server on the toplists I added my server to, and if I wasn’t even aloud to do so, I’d be pretty outraged, specially considering I’ve been a sponsored server multiple times. So basically, I’m saying don’t add it at all. If a server’s really that bad that people want to take some time out of their lives to post negative comments, the server won’t be doing so well on the toplist anyway. If it’s that good that it deserves good comments, it will be doing well on the toplist. If it’s goo and not doing well on the toplist, positive comments won’t help, as no one would even see them anyway.

On the hit counter topic, you should add an option to let the owner make it public or private

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

What we did on Minestatus was allow comments and not allow server owners to delete them. We think that a players opinion is important in the representation of a server (which is what a server list is all about). If it’s hate speech or ridiculous spam/etc. we have an option to report the comment to an administrator for deletion. Furthermore, a server owner can choose to enable or disable all commenting on their server if they just don’t want to deal with it.

I think it’s unnecessary. If the server’s description is not enough to sway someone to play a certain server, a bunch of guys saying “THIS SERVER IS AWESOME!!!” isn’t going to help. Specially since a server owner could easily get a bunch of his irl friends to post it, regardless of whether or not they play or even like runescape/rsps.

In other words, dedicate your time to something less useless =P
